introduction.para: You can combine data from multiple cells into a single cell using the Ampersand symbol (&) or the CONCAT function.

section.title: Combine data with the Ampersand symbol (&)

listItem.para: Select the cell where you want to put the combined data.
Type = and select the first cell you want to combine.
Type & and use quotation marks with a space enclosed.
Select the next cell you want to combine and press enter. An example formula might be =A2&" "&B2.

section.title: Combine data using the CONCAT function

listItem.para: Select the cell where you want to put the combined data.
Select the cell you want to combine first.
Use commas to separate the cells you are combining and use quotation marks to add spaces, commas, or other text.
Close the formula with a parenthesis and press Enter. An example formula might be =CONCAT(A2, " Family").

content.para: You can always ask an expert in the Excel Tech Communityhttps://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Excel/ct-p/Excel_Cat, get support in the Answers communityhttps://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=827514, or suggest a new feature or improvement on Excel User Voicehttps://excel.uservoice.com/.
